115232121.content:
♪ Doofenshmirtz Evil Incorporated! ♪

Agent P leaps from the drivers seat of his flying car and lands on the balcony of his arch-nemesis's building, Heinz Doofenshmirtz. Just mere moments ago, Perry was briefed of his mission by his superior, Major Monogram. Apparently, all the dolls and doll-related accessories have been swiped from every supplying store in the Tri-State Area, much to the sadness of little girls everywhere. There was only one person ridiculous enough to be responsible - Doofenshmirtz, back at it again with one of his overly complicated inators, a daily issue for the young platypus to overcome.

Scurrying into the building, Perry was suddenly snatched by Doofenshmirtz's giant and clumsy robotic man, Norm, who proceeds to shove him into constraining, platypus-sized, doll clothes, severely limiting his ability to move. "Ah, Perry the platypus, nice of you to get dolled up for the occasion. Hahaha, get it?" Dr. Doofenshmirtz asked, hysterical. Perry gave a lifeless stare in return. "Well you're no fun. Anyway, I bet you are wondering what evil and diabolical scheme I cooked up for today. Well behold!" Doofenshmirtz pulls away a large sheet that was covering a massive machine in the center of the room. The device was shaped oddly like a large, pink dollhouse, fitted with a funnel piped into the chimney and a large laser attachment sticking out of the 2nd story window. The funnel was stuffed with discarded dolls, dollhouses, doll clothes, and other miscellaneous accessories. Near the south side of the house, where a circuit breaker would normally lie, laid a few buttons and switches to control the machine. "The Dollification-inator!"

"I bet you wonder what it does, eh?" Perry released a monotone purr in response. "I knew you were going to say that, but I'm going to tell you anyway. But first, a backstory. You see, back in Drusselstein, as you probably know, I was always second to my brother. As a result, I was forced to wear hand-me-up dresses and, more importantly to this backstory, play with girly dolls while my brother always played with the latest actions figures. So, with my Dollification-inator here, I will give Roger a taste of his own medicine by turning him into a puny doll. Unfit to lead, he will be forced out of position as mayor, which will open the spot up for me to take over the whole Tri-State-Area!"

Perry rolls his eyes back, unimpressed. "Hey, don't roll your eyes at me. Do you know how hard it is to think up and create a new evil scheme every day? It's hard you know." Doofenshmirtz begins to push his -inator from the center of the room, out towards the balcony. Meanwhile, he continues to ramble as he puts all his body weight into pushing the heavy machine. "First I have to think up of some tragic backstory, to which there is a lot to choose from, but then I have to figure out whether or not I can incorporate one into a Tri-State-Area snatching evil scheme. Once that's decided I gotta make blueprints and collect all the materials to build the inator, and then build the inator of course, and this is all happens before you get here. It's stressful, that kind of time crunch, so they can't all be winners here. It's like they say in Drusselstein, 'You get what you get, and if you cry Der Kinderlumper will come and take you away', though I'm not sure how that saying translates over here."

Perry continues to stare as Doofenshmirtz slowly pushes the inator towards the balcony, making a terrible screeching sound as it drags along the floor. Doofenshmirtz is visibly tired from pushing the machine. "Man, I really should have put wheels on this thing. You see? This is what I was talking about, the time crunch. There was only time to install either wheels or a self-destruct button before you arrived and, well, I think you know what I chose." After an agonizing few minutes of monologue and loud screeching, the machine was finally settled on the balcony, and began to power up. Exhausted from the physical labor though, Doofenshmirtz walks over to Perry and leans himself upon his head to catch his breath.

"Gasp ... gasp ... just give me a second Perry the Platypus to catch my breath. I'm not in the best shape to be doing such strenuous physical labor, at least, that is what my doctor told me." As Doof's hand laid upon his head, Perry saw his opportunity to escape. So, he lifted his bill up and bit one of Doofenshmirtz fingers, causing his nemesis to cry in pain. "Ahh! Cheap move, Perry the Platypus, biting a off-guard evil scientist who just called for a truce. For shame Perry the Platypus, for shame. Well if you want a fight, take this!" Still unable to move, Perry was forced to take a direct kick from Doofenshmirtz, launching himself across the room and ripping the doll clothes constricting him in the process.

With a perfect landing, Perry immediately started to advance towards Doofenshmirtz and the inator, set on ending this mission quickly. "Oh no! You've escaped Perry the Platypus, but too late for you, because my Dollification-inator is all charged up. Norm, be useful for once, and take care of him!"

"Aye aye, sir!" Towering above Perry, Norm easily blocks his progress towards the inator. "I'm sorry, but Dr. D says no running in the apartment." Norm begins to bend down in order to grab Perry, as he did earlier by surprise, but this time Perry is prepared. He leaps out of Norm's grasp and, thanks to his slow movements, is able to hit Norm with a good blow to the head with his tail. With his head spinning out of control, Norm dizzily spins out of Perry's way and falls into a pile of inator components in the corner. "My head is a merry-go-round!"

"You're too late Perry the Platypus! My Dollification-inator is charged up and all I have to do now is press this but--" Suddenly, Perry interrupts Doof mid-sentence, causing him to slam into the control panel of the inator. As a result, the inator begins to fluctuate in aim and manages to fire off two unnoticed, rouge shots into Danville. Meanwhile, Perry and Doofenshmirtz continue to brawl it out, trading blows back and forth, the usual procedure. Eventually however, as things usually go, Perry gains the upper hand and manages to give Doof a forceful kick across the apartment, not so unlike the one he just gave Perry a moment ago. With no one left in his path, Perry is free to run up to the inator and hit the convenient self-destruct button, ignoring the cries from his nemesis for him to stop. With a huge explosion, pieces of the Dollification-inator are launched across the room, and a significant portion of Doofenshmirtz's balcony is damaged.

As Perry jumps off the building to land in his flying car, he could hear the defeated cry of his nemesis, "Curse you, Perry the Platypus!"

Now alone, Dr. Doofenshmirtz rises to his feet and begins to assess the damages, "I knew I should have installed the wheels."

"But no Doofenshmirtz Evil Incorporated brand inator is complete without a self-destruct button, sir," Norm states, sarcastically.

"Oh, so we got a wise guy, huh? Well if you want to act like that, have fun cleaning up this mess. I'm going to bed."

With Doofenshmirtz's plot foiled and Agent P returning to his family, the Tri-State-Area is safe yet again. Except, what happened to the rough, Dollification-inator beams?
115232121.title: Dollification-inator

12533222.content:
How about one of the females from Steven Universe?

Your options include:

A: Peridot, the Homeworld Scientist. Cold, impersonal, and smart, she has just failed the invasion of Earth. With her superiority now crushed, she'd be an easy target to torment. That, and she hates humans, creating another edge of advantage for you (Unless you're not human, for, like, some reason...)

Or...

B: More Options...
12533222.title: No?

125332221.content:
Ah, so you have decided to mess around with one of Homeworld's greatest scientists. Wise choice, indeed....


Suddenly, the room around you swirls and twists into a variety of colors and shapes. Pale blues, sharp reds, bright greens, all are swimming around you, making you somewhat nauseous as the entire world seems to flutter about your mind. Eventually, it stops, and you find yourself on the beach. But this is no ordinary beach. This is the Beach City beach, and just a few paces away, lies a greenish humanoid figure, climbing outside some form of pod. Her hair is quite large, even from where you stand, and instantly you know who she is: Peridot. But, you end up getting distracted by a rustling in your pocket, and lo and behold, is a piece of paper. It reads "No need to worry, you have received Allymagic Grade-AAA protection spells in order to preserve your fun! Also, feel free to press the newly-installed Allymagic Meister-Button implanted into your shirt. You'll find it useful.

Weird. you think, not knowing what this "Allymagic" thing is, but you are quick to trust that, if they can transport you to Beach City, then they must not be lying about this. And heck, they even did sow a button to your shirt! Of course, it's your choice to press it.
125332221.title: Peridot, the Science Queen

info.brief_description: Be in any cartoon you want and do things to your fave cartoons.
info.description:
Your a person who likes toons way to much, you get the oper 'toon'ity to mess with you favorite or most hated toons.

Rules:
1. No character deaths
2. You can torture your most hated characters as long as it doesn't involve murder.
3. Have fun.

Add 7 chapters to win 400 points. And they have to be more than just one-liners.
